title: EMT-B Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Huron Valley Ambulance
Interview Descriptions: Very relaxed but a little difficult to schedule—simple once I got a hold of the person in charge of hiring. I was hired and started orientation within about a month of being interviewed.
Interview Questions: Where did you hear about our company from?

title: EMT-Basic Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Huron Valley Ambulance
Interview Descriptions: Relatively informal, was over the phone, quick and friendly. I did however do my training at HVA, so I am unsure if it would be more hurdle-filled for outside hires.
Interview Questions: What made you decide to work as an EMT?

title: Paramedic Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Huron Valley Ambulance (Ann Arbor, MI) in Oct 2017
Interview Descriptions: First you come in for a one on one interview and to take a written test. If you pass the first interview you get invited to a panel interview. After the panel interview comes a job offer.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work ar Huron Valley Ambulance?

title: EMT-Basic Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Huron Valley Ambulance
Interview Descriptions: There was a one on one interview with fairly straightforward questions. The interview is followed by a quiz to test your knowledge. After the quiz, I received a job offer right away.
Interview Questions: What made you decide to work in EMS?

title: EMT Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Huron Valley Ambulance
Interview Descriptions: Two different interviews, one with the recruitment coordinator and one with some company higher-ups. Agility test, physical, and a  test similiar to NREMT. Orientation lasted a week and a half.
Interview Questions: What do you expect from employer?

title: EMT-B Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Huron Valley Ambulance (Lansing, MI) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: was scrutinized for the scars on my neck. was judged on my looks more then experience. and if everyone wants to hire someone with experience. how am i supposed to gt experience

title: EMT-Basic Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Huron Valley Ambulance (Ann Arbor, MI) in Dec 2015
Interview Descriptions: It was an interview with around 3 people that talked about my resume and asked me about why I wanted to get into the provider EMS side of healthcare. It was very casual and a nice conversation. They got back to me a couple days later with a job offer
Interview Questions: why i wanted to get into EMS work

title: Paramedic Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Huron Valley Ambulance
Interview Descriptions: First interview with company recruiter, second interview a week later with panel and agility, fitness testing. Carry 250 lb dummy up and down two flights of stairs on backboard to stretcher, lower and lift stretcher with dummy on it.  8 min of CPR, tilt the dummy to a standing position while on the backboard from laying on the ground to a standing position and back down.
Interview Questions: What's your favorite restaurant?  Why should we hire you?  Why shouldn't we hire you? If you could choose anyone living or dead to have lunch with who would it be? Greatest strength?  Greatest weakness? Tell me about yourself.

title: Paramedic Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Huron Valley Ambulance in Sept 2010
Interview Descriptions: lots of testing, county protocols, map, driving, equipment, cpr, back boarding. A physical agility. The interview was a panel of supervisors, VP's, and Field training officers. Lasts about 30-45 min. Be prepared to answer real life senerios.
Interview Questions: If you were a dog, what would you be and why???

title: Paramedic Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Huron Valley Ambulance (Plymouth, MI) in Aug 2009
Interview Descriptions: know about the company, the business. There is testing involved similar to the state testing, county tests, protocol tests, maping and routing tests.  be confident not cocky!!!  they have an excellent training program to learn the company and how things are done the right way, you will not be thrown to the wolves like most other companies.
Interview Questions: what kind of dog would you be if you could and why??

title: EMT-B Full Time Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Huron Valley Ambulance (Ann Arbor, MI) in Jan 2008
Interview Descriptions: Interview, followed by interview by the board.
Interview Questions: If you were a dog what kind of dog would you be and why?
